text: “And you, son of man, take a brick and set it in front of you. Inscribe a city on it—Jerusalem.

<st data-num="05414" class="">Lay</st> <st data-num="04692" class="">siege</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">to</st> it! <st data-num="01129" class="">Build</st> <st data-num="01785" class="">siege works</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">against</st> it. <st data-num="08210" class="">Erect</st> a <st data-num="05550" class="">siege ramp</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="05921" class="">against</st> it! <st data-num="05414" class="">Post</st> <st data-num="04264" class="">soldiers</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">outside</st> it<n id="2" /> and <st data-num="07760" class="">station</st> <st data-num="03733" class="">battering rams</st> <st data-num="05921 05439">around</st> it.

Then for your part take an iron frying pan and set it up as an iron wall between you and the city. Set your face toward it. It is to be under siege; you are to besiege it. This is a sign for the house of Israel.
“Also for your part lie on your left side and place the iniquity of the house of Israel on it. For the number of days you lie on your side you will bear their iniquity.
I have determined that the number of the years of their iniquity are to be the number of days for you—390 days. So bear the iniquity of the house of Israel.
“When you have completed these days, then lie down a second time, but on your right side, and bear the iniquity of the house of Judah 40 days—I have assigned one day for each year.

You must <st data-num="03559" class="">turn</st> your <st data-num="06440" class="">face</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">toward</st> the <st data-num="04692" class="">siege</st> of <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st> with your <st data-num="02220" class="">arm</st> <st data-num="02834" class="">bared</st> and <st data-num="05012" class="">prophesy</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">against</st> it.
Look here: I will tie you up with ropes, so you cannot turn from one side to the other until you complete the days of your siege.

“As for you, take wheat, barley, beans, lentils, millet, and spelt, put them in a single container, and make food from them for yourself. For the same number of days that you lie on your side—390 days—you will eat it.

The <st data-num="03978 0834">food</st> you <st data-num="0398" class="">eat</st> will be <st data-num="06242" class="">eight</st> <st data-num="08255" class="">ounces</st><n id="1" /> a <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st> by <st data-num="04946" class="">weight</st>; you must <st data-num="0398" class="">eat</st> it <st data-num="06256 05704 06256">at fixed times</st>.<n id="2" />

And you must <st data-num="08354" class="">drink</st> <st data-num="04325" class="">water</st> by <st data-num="04884" class="">measure</st>, a <st data-num="08345 01969">pint and a half</st>;<n id="1" /> you must <st data-num="08354" class="">drink</st> it <st data-num="06256 05704 06256">at fixed times</st>.

And you must <st data-num="0398" class="">eat</st> the food as you would a <st data-num="08184" class="">barley</st> <st data-num="05692" class="">cake</st>. You must <st data-num="05746" class="">bake</st> <st data-num="01931" class="">it</st> in front of <st data-num="05869" class="">them</st> over a fire made with <st data-num="01561" class="">dried</st> <st data-num="0120" class="">human</st> <st data-num="06627" class="">excrement</st>.”<n id="1" />
And the Lord said, “This is how the people of Israel will eat their unclean food among the nations where I will banish them.”

And I said, “Ah, Sovereign Lord, I have never been ceremonially defiled before. I have never eaten a carcass or an animal torn by wild beasts; from my youth up, unclean meat has never entered my mouth.”
So he said to me, “All right then, I will substitute cow’s manure instead of human excrement. You will cook your food over it.”
Then he said to me, “Son of man, I am about to remove the bread supply in Jerusalem. They will eat their bread ration anxiously, and they will drink their water ration in terror
because they will lack bread and water. Each one will be terrified, and they will rot for their iniquity.
